primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The sovereign God invades the old aeon of Sin and Death to level the obstacles of human pride and estrangement, revealing His glory and reconciling the world to Himself.

tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord is going to prepare his own way
God is going to tear down that curtain and flatten the hills
He will turn the hearts of parents to their children

object.identificatie: Reconciliation / The Kingdom of God / Revelation of Glory
tekstueel_bewijs: the glory of the Lord shall be revealed
the new day of the righteousness of God

zender.identificatie: The Mouth of the Lord / The Prophetic Word
tekstueel_bewijs: for the mouth of the Lord has spoken
God sent John the Baptist into the world at the appointed time

ontvanger.identificatie: All flesh / The Church / Estranged families
tekstueel_bewijs: all flesh shall see it together
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of the 'leveling' operation.

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Holy Spirit (implied) / The Act of Repentance
tekstueel_bewijs: John the Baptist... is the beginning of the gospel
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who uses the Helper (John) to prepare the way.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that enables the 'strong' to repent.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Old Aeon (Sin and Death) / Human Pride / Estrangement
tekstueel_bewijs: the old age of Sin and Death
our most cherished strategies and defenses
the spirit of rebellion against God
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but a 'spirit of rebellion' and an 'old age' that requires a 'turn of the ages' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and seeking reconciliation as a participation in God's primary work.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human action is explicitly framed as a 'participation' in what God is already doing ('We are not doing it; he is doing it').

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist → God ← Sin and Death
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → Leveling the Mountains of Pride

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is going to tear down that curtain
the Lord is going to prepare his own way
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you and I have been hauling out catalogues

voorbeelden: we wouldn’t have it any other way
to understand what Mark is up to, we have to know the Hebrew Bible
we can trust the unfolding of his purpose

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power (Pouvoir) to effect change, which then grants the hearer the competence to repent.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Sin/Death) through ~S1 (Estrangement) to ~S2 (Repentance) and finally S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'cut-and-fill' operation which removes the 'mountains' of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; Sin and Death are treated as cosmic aeons, not just mistakes.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon calls for strenuous human action (repentance), it consistently grounds this action in the prior and superior action of God.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human effort in reconciliation
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Reconciliation is hard work. It requires daily repentance.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the primary agent of the 'highway' construction
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the prophetic voice announces that the Lord is going to prepare his own way.
We are not doing it; he is doing it; that’s why we can trust.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is presented as a herald and a sign of the turn of the ages, not a moral example to be imitated.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: John is the 'alarming man' God uses to signal the end of the old world.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the pressure to 'level the mountains' is shifted to God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification: God works in us that which is pleasing in His sight.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The metaphor of 'cut-and-fill' perfectly bridges the gap between the ancient text and the contemporary ethical application.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Prepare ye' (imperative) and 'The Lord will prepare' (indicative).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the long-anticipated day of the Lord when the old age of Sin and Death will pass away.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'rainbows of grace' provide the power to do the 'hard work' of reconciliation.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is an 'aeon' and a 'spirit of rebellion' that requires a cosmic shift to overcome.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject while calling for human response.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Savoir (teaching the history of John).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current Pouvoir (God's power) focus.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'cut-and-fill' more directly to the Cross.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strong (Sin and Death as cosmic powers).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God levels the hills) → Ethics (We seek reconciliation).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon successfully avoids the 'moralistic trap' by framing human repentance as a participation in God's sovereign, cosmic operation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'cut-and-fill' metaphor's persuasiveness; Greimas reveals that the metaphor functions to keep God as the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah 40; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' mirrors the text's own movement from command to promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'hard work' of reconciliation is actually a 'Secondary Program' nested within God's 'Fundamental Program'.

volledige_subject_lijst: The mouth of the Lord (has spoken)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the Rutledge Rule effectively by making God the subject of the leveling verbs.
